title: Russia Sends Ill-Trained Draftees Into Combat Amid Losses, Analysts Say
description: Ukraine’s military and Western analysts say Russian forces are making fruitless attacks in eastern Ukraine and taking heavy losses after a hastily arranged draft added over 300,000 troops.

title: The Search for Missing Russian Soldiers
description: Russian families searching for loved ones say the system for finding missing soldiers is as disorganized as Vladimir Putin’s military effort, which has been marked by dysfunction from the beginning.

title: Imran Khan’s Supporters Clash With Police in Pakistan After Gunman Attack
description: The former prime minister accused military and government officials of plotting the attack that wounded him as political violence welled up around Pakistan.

title: U.S. Will Pay Tribes to Rebuild Away From Climate Threats
description: The Interior Department has selected the winners of a new competition to relocate communities vulnerable to climate change. It could become a model for the rest of the country.

title: New US Command and $400 Million More in Aid Signal Longterm US Support for Ukraine
description: The Pentagon’s resolution to supplying Ukraine with weaponry and the new command are clear signals that the U.S. expects the threat from Russia to Ukraine and its neighbors to persist for years, officials said.

title: Young Migrants Describe Hunger, Illness and Trauma at UK Asylum Center
description: The overcrowded facility in southeastern England is supposed to house asylum seekers for very short periods, but teenagers who have stayed there detailed inhumane conditions and long stays.

title: U.S., Allies Vow to Protect Ukraine’s Infrastructure From Russian Attacks
description: Top diplomats from the Group of 7 nations discussed sending more air defense equipment to Ukraine and agreed to coordinate on rebuilding its infrastructure.

title: As Israel’s Far Right Nears Power, Palestinians Feel a Pang of Fear
description: To some Palestinians, the rise of the Israeli far right can scarcely make things worse. But many fear a surge of violence.

title: Germany’s Leader Seeks Accord With China on Covid Vaccines
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz said during a visit to Beijing that China and the European Union were working toward approval of each other’s pandemic vaccines.

title: Who Will NATO’s Next Secretary General Be?
description: The behind-the-scenes jockeying for who should succeed Jens Stoltenberg has begun in earnest, with a focus on women.

title: Kherson braces for battle as the Russian administration evacuates.
As Protests Rage, Iran Marks Anniversary of US Embassy Takeover
description: State-backed demonstrations to mark the 1979 event, a touchstone of the Iranian Revolution, were widely broadcast on TV and come as anti-government protests have rocked the country.

title: Signs of Russia’s Rule Disappear From Kherson, but Its Soldiers Do Not
description: The city’s remaining residents are stocking up on food and fuel to survive combat, unsure of what to believe and afraid of what comes next.

title: In Bid to Show It Is Open, Hong Kong Bends Covid Rules … for Some
description: Three splashy events this week were meant to prove that the former British colony was still “Asia’s World City.” But Covid exemptions were provided for visitors from overseas, especially the wealthy ones.

title: India’s Air Pollution Season Is Off to a Terrible Start.
description: Toxic air in northern India this week has prompted school closures, traffic restrictions and political infighting. “We are not breathing air but smoking it,” one activist said.

title: A Poll Reversal
description: Republicans have swiftly gained ground near the end of midterm elections polling.

title: China’s Out-of-Control Rocket Booster Is Headed Back to Earth
description: For the fourth time, the country’s space program has used a 23-ton launcher that has scattered debris after previous flights.

title: 3-Year-Old in China Dies After Covid Restrictions Delayed Care
description: When the boy’s father asked for help getting his son to the hospital, he was told to put on a mask. Local officials promised to “learn from this painful lesson.”

title: As Other Global Crises Collide, Nations Converge to Address Climate Change
description: The United States will try to reassert global leadership at global talks in Egypt.

title: Five Ways Sanctions Are Hitting Russia
description: Russia’s economy and residents have taken a battering, but the government continues to reap big revenues from energy sales. A partial European embargo on oil takes effect in December.

title: For Ghana’s Only Openly Transgender Musician, ‘Every Day Is Dangerous’
description: Maxine Angel Opoku has found a new audience for her music with songs opposing a proposed law that would make it illegal to identify as gay, transgender or queer.

title: Ukrainians Turn to Diaries for Solace, and to Share Life in Wartime
description: Writers have long used diaries to make sense of life. Now, diaries can be shared in real time, helping shape public perception of events as they unfold — including war.

title: What a Job Posting That Went Viral Says About New Zealand
description: The country is popularly viewed as a place where you can get away from it all, but that doesn’t mean it is without its own entrenched problems.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: A preview of the U.N. climate summit.

title: ‘I’m Afraid for My Future’: Proposed Laws Threaten Gay Life in Russia
description: The laws, all but assured of enactment, would intensify a crackdown on L.G.B.T.Q. freedom in Russia, which Vladimir V. Putin has cast as a corrosive Western influence.

title: Corrections: Nov. 4, 2022
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Nov. 4, 2022.
